Article.Abstract: Six different mouse monoclonal antibodies (MAbs) and a specific rabbit polygonal antibody were raised against listeriolysin. Four of the MAbs also recognized seeligeriolysin, and five cross-reacted with ivanolysin. The hemolytic activity could be neutralized by the polygonal antibody as well as by five of the MAbs. None of the neutralizing antibodies interfered with the binding of listeriolysin to the cellular membrane. The epitopes recognized by the MAbs were localized by using overlapping synthetic peptides between positions 59 and 279, a region hitherto not implicated in mediating hemolytic activity.
Article.ArticleTitle: Neutralizing monoclonal antibodies against listeriolysin: mapping of epitopes involved in pore formation.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Cell Biology and Immunology, National Research Centre for Biotechnology, Braunschweig, Germany.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antibodies, Monoclonal;Bacterial Toxins;Heat-Shock Proteins;Hemolysin Proteins;hlyA protein, Listeria monocytogenes
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Antibodies, Monoclonal(immunology); Bacterial Toxins; Epitope Mapping; Heat-Shock Proteins(immunology; toxicity); Hemolysin Proteins(immunology); Hemolysis; Mice; Molecular Sequence Data; Rabbits

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The assay investigated the ability of the monoclonal antibody to neutralize the hemolytic activity of listeriolysin by incubation with listeriolysin, adding sheep erythrocytes, and measuring the amount of hemoglobin released. The neutralization activity was reported as strong. To distinguish whether the neutralizing antibody inhibited binding of listeriolysin to the cellular membrane or a subsequent step, the monoclonal antibody was preincubated with listeriolysin at neutralizing concentrations and this complex was incubated with the mouse fibrblast cell line, 36.2.1. It was shown that while hemolytic activity was inhibited, the monoclonal antibody was able to bind to the fibroblasts via listeriolysin, suggesting that neutralization was not mediated by binding of listeriolysin to the cellular membrane.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Overlapping synthetic peptides that covered the entire amino acid sequence of the listeriolysin molecule were synthesized as spots on specially derivatized cellulose paper.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The monoclonal antibody was shown to cross-react with the hemolysin of Listeria seeligeri (Seeligerolysin), which contains a well-conserved homologous amino acid sequence (LTLSVDLP). The authors reported intermediate cross-reactivity.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The monoclonal antibody was shown to cross-react with the hemolysin of Listeria seeligeri (Seeligerolysin), which contains a well-conserved homologous amino acid sequence (TLVERW). The authors reported strong cross-reactivity.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The monoclonal antibody was shown to cross-react with the hemolysin of Listeria ivanovii (Ivanolysin), which contains a well-conserved homologous amino acid sequence (TLVDRW). The authors reported strong cross-reactivity.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Overlapping synthetic peptides that covered the entire amino acid sequence of the listeriolysin molecule were synthesized as spots on specially derivatized cellulose paper.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The monoclonal antibody was shown to cross-react with the hemolysin of Listeria ivanovii (Ivanolysin), which contains a well-conserved homologous amino acid sequence (WNNKYSE). The authors reported strong cross-reactivity.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The assay investigated the ability of the monoclonal antibody to neutralize the hemolytic activity of listeriolysin by incubation with listeriolysin, adding sheep erythrocytes, and measuring the amount of hemoglobin released. Neutralization activity was not detectable.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Overlapping synthetic peptides that covered the entire amino acid sequence of the listeriolysin molecule were synthesized as spots on specially derivatized cellulose paper.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The monoclonal antibody did not cross-react with the hemolysin of Listeria seeligeri (Seeligerolysin), which contains a well-conserved homologous amino acid sequence (WNDKYSK).

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The monoclonal antibody was shown to cross-react with the hemolysin of Listeria ivanovii (Ivanolysin), which contains a well-conserved homologous amino acid sequence (GKSVTKENL). The authors reported strong cross-reactivity.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Overlapping synthetic peptides that covered the entire amino acid sequence of the listeriolysin molecule were synthesized as spots on specially derivatized cellulose paper.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The monoclonal antibody was shown to cross-react with the hemolysin of Listeria seeligeri (Seeligerolysin), which contains a well-conserved homologous amino acid sequence (GGSVTKEQL). The authors reported weak cross-reactivity.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against formaldehyde-treated, concentrated culture supernatant derived from Listeria monocytogenes EGD.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The assay investigated the ability of the monoclonal antibody to neutralize the hemolytic activity of listeriolysin by incubation with listeriolysin, adding sheep erythrocytes, and measuring the amount of hemoglobin released. The neutralization activity was reported as strong at high concentrations. To distinguish whether the neutralizing antibody inhibited binding of listeriolysin to the cellular membrane or a subsequent step, the monoclonal antibody was preincubated with listeriolysin at neutralizing concentrations and this complex was incubated with the mouse fibrblast cell line, 36.2.1. It was shown that while hemolytic activity was inhibited, the monoclonal antibody was able to bind to the fibroblasts via listeriolysin, suggesting that neutralization was not mediated by binding of listeriolysin to the cellular membrane.
